channel.title: Fabrication on Dan Oved's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Fabrication on Dan Oved's Blog

item.title: PCB Circuit Fabrication With the Othermill
item.description: For this homework assignment for Homemade Hardware, we were to fabricate a PCB Board using the Othermill. I continued with the previous design of an ATTiny85 controlling the brightness of an LED based on the reading from an HC-sr04 Ultrasonic Distance Sensor. I modified it slightly based on the instructions from class. A 1k resistor connect the reset pin of the ATTiny85 to the power, and the output LED pin would be connected via a TIP120 Transistor to the ground line of the LEDs.

item.title: Turning Muscle Power into Usable Electricity
item.description: For our Kinetic Energy assignment, with which I collaborated with Arnav Wagh, it was time to build something that would turn muscle power into usable electricity. Selecting the Motor To power the lights, we would force a dc gear motor to turn and tap into the electricty it generates. We chose a 127 RPM Mini Econ Gear Motor from ServoCity, because it had optimal RPM and a low torque of 9,602 kgf-cm.
